Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Game
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
Object representing a Masters of Renaissance match.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Game​(Server server, int gameId, java.util.List<java.lang.String> nicknameList)
    Creates a game instance.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void connect​(java.lang.String nickname)
    Marks the player as connected to the game.
    void disconnect​(java.lang.String nickname)
    Marks the player as disconnected from the game.
    void end()
    Terminates the match and executes tear-down routines to deregister the game from its host server.

    GameState getCurrentState()
    Returns the current state of the game as an element of the GameState enum.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game​(Server server, int gameId, java.util.List<java.lang.String> nicknameList) throws java.io.IOException
      Creates a game instance.
      Parameters:
      gameId - game identifier.
      nicknameList - optional list of nicknames. When this parameter is null the game gets restored from disk, when present a fresh game instance is created.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - exception thrown when game files or folders are corrupt.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentState

      public GameState getCurrentState()
      Returns the current state of the game as an element of the GameState enum.

    • subscribe

      public void subscribe​(RemoteView remoteView)
      Subscribes a RemoteView to the game's model updates.
      Parameters:
      remoteView - RemoteView object that will receive all model publishes.

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of players in the game.

    • getPlayerList

      public java.util.List<Player> getPlayerList()
      The returned list of players contains all Player objects in the current game. The list is sorted, the first element is the Player with the Inkwell marker, in position 1. If the Inkwell has not been assigned yet, the returned list is unordered and all positions are set to 0.
      Returns:
      list of Players.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Returns the only player in the game who has a matching nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - identifier for the wanted Player.
      Returns:
      Player instance, null if a nickname not present in the game gets passed as parameter.

    • getCurrentTurnPlayer

      public java.util.Optional<Player> getCurrentTurnPlayer()
      Returns:
      instance of the Player currently playing its turn.

    • getActionTokenDeck

      public ActionTokenDeck getActionTokenDeck()
      Returns:
      ActionTokenDeck instance associated to the game.

    • sortPlayers

      public void sortPlayers()
      Sorts the players' list in ascending order. Must be called only after the Inkwell has been assigned otherwise the sorting process is meaningless.

    • connect

      public void connect​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Marks the player as connected to the game.
      Parameters:
      nickname - Player identifier.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Marks the player as disconnected from the game.
      Parameters:
      nickname - Player identifier.

    • setState

      public void setState​(GameState gameState)
      Updates the current GameState.
      Parameters:
      gameState - specified GameState.

    • getMarket

      public Market getMarket()
      Returns:
      returns the only Market instance in the game.

    • getLeaderCardsDeck

      public LeaderCardsDeck getLeaderCardsDeck()
      Returns:
      returns the only LeaderCardsDeck instance in the game.

    • getDevelopmentCardsBoard

      public DevelopmentCardsBoard getDevelopmentCardsBoard()
      Returns:
      returns the only DevelopmentCardsBoard instance in the game.

    • end

      public void end()
      Terminates the match and executes tear-down routines to deregister the game from its host server.
